text: Flooring type (LVT, VCT, sheet vinyl, rubber) and pattern match finish schedule and approved submittals
Adhesive, moisture barrier, and levelling compound match manufacturer’s system
Baseboards, nosings, reducer strips, and accessories confirmed on site
Materials stored flat, clean, and conditioned for 24–48 hrs per manufacturer
Subfloor dry, flat, smooth, and cleaned of dust or debris
Floor levelled to spec (typically ≤1/8” in 10 feet)
Moisture content and RH tested and within limits for flooring system
Layout approved and aligned with architectural drawing or reference point
Directional arrows followed (if LVT or rubber planks)
Adhesive applied uniformly, allowed open time, and flooring rolled as per spec
Expansion joints installed at required locations and door thresholds
No bubbles, curling, or hollow spots in finished surface
Cove base or straight base installed cleanly and tight to wall
Transition strips secure and smooth at doorways or flooring changes
Stairs: nosings, treads, and risers properly aligned and glued
Surface clean and free from residue, adhesive stains, or scuff marks
Visual inspection completed by contractor and consultant
Closeout documents submitted (warranties, cleaning instructions, adhesives used)

id: • ASTM F710, ASTM F1869, ASTM F2170 – Substrate Conditions
• Manufacturer Specs: Tarkett, Armstrong, Forbo, Mondo, Mannington, Gerflor
